person.persName: James D. Simpson (Winchester, Ky judge and attorney)

body.p: Winchester, Kentucky, judge, banker, and politician. Belfast, Ireland, native. Son of James Simpson, Sr. Married Mary L. Caldwell Simpson on February 22, 1825. Father of Fanny I. Simpson, Mary H. Simpson, Carrie Simpson, Isaac P. Simpson, and James D. Simpson III. Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, resident from 1797 to 1807. Studied law under Samuel Hanson in Winchester. Licensed to practice law on February 18, 1817 in Winchester. Practiced law in partnership with Chilton Allen from 1817 to 1827 in Winchester. Mayor of Winchester. President of the Winchester Cemetery Company. Circuit court judge from 1835 to 1847. Associate Justice of the Kentucky Court of Appeals from 1847 to 1860. Elected to the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Clark County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned thirteen enslaved people in Winchester in 1860. Partner with William Winn and James Simpson in the Deposit Bank of Winn, Simpson & Co. in Winchester. Member of the Presbyterian Church.
